page.title: 07A DAY IN THE LIFE OF
page.content:
Every morning Glenda gets up at quarter past seven, her alarm clock wakes her enabling her to be punctual for her paper run. School starts at nine o'clock and for Glenda another uneventful day begins. Recently school has become boring for her as she would rather participate in other activities such as more reading and art. School meals are available at lunch time but she prefers to lunch in the cafe at ASDA.
Night life in Blantyre is non-existent for teenagers, so Glenda visits her friends houses or they come to hers. There is a sports centre which can be expensive and really only caters for the sporty type.
